results.title: Unions: putting you in the picture
results.brief_description: Designed to inform the migrant worker of the basic working of trade unions, and how they can become more involved in union activities. Shows the historical development of trade-unions in Australia and explains the functions of the members, delegates, organisers, branches and the ACTU. Contains some scenes in b&w.

results.title: Union street
results.brief_description: Union Street is a street just like any other, situated opposite the train line and underneath the flight path. None of the residents get along with each other particularly well, they just go about their daily business in isolation from the activities occurring next door. All this changes when the Armstrong-Taylors decide to renovate, acting as the catalyst to community involvement. The microcosm of the neighbourhood acts as a commentary on the changing face of Australia as the different cultural backgrounds of the individual households interact. Narrated by Andrew Denton.

results.title: Union local
results.creator_credit: John Barnwell and Louis De Rochemont
results.brief_description: How Union 342, a trade union of industrial machinists, contributes to the security and well-being of American citizens. Shows the structure and activities of a union: duties of union officers; handling of grievances; collective bargaining; wage and work negotiations; and other labor-management relations.

results.title: Union is strength: the story of plywood
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”
The structure of wood makes it liable to split or be broken along the grain. This film describes how this tendency can be overcome by the construction of plywood.

results.title: UNICEF: the first forty years
results.brief_description: Presents a comprehensive history of UNICEF since its formation in 1946 to the present day. Catalogues its worth in the developing countries and indicates its success in various projects to improve the health, nutrition and social development of millions of people. No other credits available.

results.title: Unemployment: voices from the line
results.creator_credit: Pierre Lasry, Mark Zannis, Peter Katadotis and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A film about the effects of unemployment on the lives of individuals and their families. It exposes the harsh realities of unemployment and graphically depicts situations that contradict the notion that unemployment insurance takes care of the problems. The film illustrates that most unemployed persons prefer to work and that the real cost of unemployment is human suffering. Unemployment: Voices from the Line is a powerful and disturbing account of a national tragedy that, until now, has been viewed solely in economic terms.

results.title: Unemployment and money: the principles involved
results.brief_description: A description and discussion of the principles which cause a recurrence of unemployment. Describes in detail the circulation of money and the place of banks in the monetary system.

results.title: Unemployment
results.creator_credit: Graeme Turner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Making Sense of Society”.
Presents two real-life cases of individuals who have actually experienced being unemployed. Dave Hunt of Sunderland has been out of work for 8 years. John Lockyer of Watford was unemployed for 4 months in 1971 but has been continuously in employment since then. Demonstrates the effect unemployment has had on their lives and their families.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
(HSC Economics series) Covers definitions of terms, general and specific causes and measurement of unvoluntary unemployment and the scenario relating to unemployment with productivity and demand. No other credits available.
